RECORD.TEXT:
05841983 728467 8/13/1990 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary DIS Admission Date : Report Status : Discharge Date : 08/22/1990 DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS : 1) MULTIPLE SCLEROSIS . 2) ANEMIA . 3) URINARY TRACT INFECTION . Patient is a 32 year old white female with multiple sclerosis admitted for the Ensuerlpack Medical Center protocol group II Cytoxan and ACTH with Methylprednisolone maintenance . In 09/06 , she presented to her primary local Medical doctor with persistent complaints of right lower extremity weakness . In March of l987 , she was referred to a Neurologist in Zorak , Conn and had an MRI , evoked potentials , EMG , and CT scan but no lumbar puncture . She was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis . In April of l987 , she was treated with Prednisone times ten days and felt better but rebounded to an even lower level of function after discontinuation of the Prednisone . In December of l987 , she was treated with Baclofen times fourteen days without improvement . In May of l988 , she began walking with a cane . 1) Multiple sclerosis as above . 2) Status post appendectomy at age ten . Patient receives antibiotics for dental procedures . CURRENT MEDICATIONS : Multivitamin one tablet p.o. q.d. , Vitamin E 800 units q.d. , Vitamin Bl2 one tablet p.o. q.d. , Diazepam 0.5 mg p.r.n. REVIEW OF SYSTEMS : She has frequent urination without dysuria , burning , or malodor . FAMILY HISTORY : Includes hypertension in her mother and muscular dystrophy in one brother . No tobacco , ethanol , or intravenous drug use . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : On admission , her temperature was 97.7 , blood pressure was ll8/70 , heart rate of 88 , and respiratory rate of l8 . Height was five foot and five and a half inches , weight 98 pounds , and surface area l.46 meters squared . Extraocular muscles were intact with three beat lateral nystagmus bilaterally . NECK : Showed fibrocystic changes bilaterally without discharge or skin change . LUNGS : CARDIOVASCULAR : Showed a regular rate and rhythm with a II / VI late systolic murmur at the apex radiating to the axilla . No jugular venous distention was observed . Remarkable for positive bowel sounds , no masses , no hepatosplenomegaly , non-tender , and non-distended . The right tibia had an anterior bulge without bruising . NEUROLOGICAL : Presidents were , reportedly going backwards , Bush , Reagan , Ford , Carter , and Kennedy . She spelled world correctly . Her interpretation of proverbs was appropriate . Visual acuity was 20/30 bilaterally with correction . Fundi showed pale discs bilaterally requiring ten diopters to focus . Extraocular muscles were intact , cranial nerve V was intact to fine touch bilaterally , and facial expression was normal and symmetric . Auditory acuity was intact to finger rub . Palate was elevated , left greater than right . Sensation was intact to fine touch times four extremities and proprioception times four extremities . Reflexes were 3+ throughout except 2+ at the ankles . Grip was 4+ on the left and less than 3 on the right . Biceps were 3 on the right and 5 minus on the left . Triceps were 2+ on the right and 5 minus on the left . Deltoids were 3+ on the right and 4 minus on the left . Hip flexors were less than 3 bilaterally . Knee extensors were 3+ bilaterally . LABORATORY EXAMINATION : Creatinine was 0.8 and glucose was 96 . Urinalysis revealed a specific gravity of l.0l5 , a pH of 8.0 , l+ ketones , and no blood . Chest X-Ray showed hyperinflation bilaterally and loss of the anterior clear space on the lateral film likely secondary to arm position since the patient was unable to raise up her arm from weakness stemming from her multiple sclerosis . EKG showed baseline artifacts , sinus tachycardia at l05 , PR interval of 0.l6 , QRS of 0.08 , QT of 0.36 , an axis of 60 degrees , poor R wave progression with transition after the V4 lead , T wave flattening in II and F , and T wave inversion in III . No old EKG was available for comparison . Patient also had an MRI scan of the head which showed a lesion in the left pons consistent with multiple sclerosis . Serum IgG was elevated at l,520 . SPEP showed an elevated gamma spike of l.83 and was otherwise within normal limits . She tolerated the protocol medications well except for some nausea and vomiting which was relatively well controlled with anti-emetic medication and also some very mild hematuria to the tune of 20 to 25 red blood cells on micro . 2) Anemia - Patient had a steady drop in hematocrit from the admission value of 43.5 to the range of about 3l by hospital day number eight which remained stable at this point . She had guaiac negative stools , no menses , no significant hematuria , and no signs of hemolysis . Work-up included an iron of l24 , TIBC of 207 , a ferritin of l24 , and Bl2 and folate were pending but unlikely to be contributing to this acute drop . Haptoglobin was l79 with a normal bilirubin and a normal LDH . Glucose was 6 , phosphate deficiency was checked with a normal level of 25 being measured , and reticulocyte count of less than 0.l% was noted at one point with follow-up reticulocyte count of 0.l% noted on the day prior to discharge . Patient did not show coincident decrease in white count or platelet count . Patient will be followed up with subsequent CBC on the September , the September , the September , and the Septemberth of 2006 to assure that her hematocrit recovers . 3) Urinary tract infection - Patient had too numerous to count white cells on urinalysis on 08/15/90 and was thus begun on Bactrim DS one tablet p.o. b.i.d. Subsequently , urine culture prior to initiation of antibiotic therapy grew out pan sensitive E. coli , greater than l00,000 including sensitivities to Bactrim . Her Foley will be discontinued at discharge and she will continue home straight catheterizations given her post-void residual of 200 cc on admission per the visiting nurse . DISPOSITION : Stable . Disposition is to home . 08/21/90 Batch : 2695 Report : X9178R1 Dicatated By : TRANGCA F. OR , M.D. OU12
CTMC 763052 Discharge Summary Signed Admission Date : 09/29/1993 10/04/1993 HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : She was diagnosed in 1991 during the birth of her child . She claims she does not know why she is HIV positive . She has not used any anti retroviral therapy since then , because of pancytopenia and vomiting on DDI . She has no relief from antacids or H2 blockers . In 10/92 , she had a CT scan which showed fatty infiltration of her liver diffusely with a 1 cm cyst in the right lobe of the liver . The patient has had progressive failure to thrive and steady weight loss . She was brought in for an esophagogastroduodenoscopy on 9/26 but she basically was not sufficiently sedated and readmitted at this time for a GI work-up as well as an evaluation of new abscess in her left lower calf and right medial lower extremity quadriceps muscle . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : ALLERGIES : BACTRIM . She lives with her daughter . She does not drink , use IV drugs or smoke . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : HEENT exam was within normal limits . Lungs were clear to auscultation and percussion bilaterally . Cardiovascular exam revealed a regular rate and rhythm without murmur . There was no hepatosplenomegaly . There was no evidence of edema . LABORATORY DATA : On admission included BUN / creatinine of 33/2.1 . Potassium 4.2 . Hematocrit 23 . Platelet count 411,000 . Urinalysis was positive for protein . Bilirubin 0.4 . There was no evidence of rib fracture . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted and many cultures were sent which were all negative . She did not have any of her pain in the hospital . On the third hospital day , she did have some pain and was treated with Percocet . She went for a debridement of her left calf lesion on 10/2/93 and was started empirically on IV ceftriaxone which was changed to po doxycycline on the day of discharge . A follow-up CT scan was done which did not show any evidence for splenomegaly or hepatomegaly . The 1 cm cyst which was seen in 10/92 was still present . There was a question of a cyst in her kidney with a stone right below the cyst , although this did not seem to be clinically significant . DISPOSITION : The patient was discharged to home in stable condition . Cultures were pending on her aspirate and will be treated with po doxycycline . Dictated By : Attending : I BUN , M.D. GR67 EF283/9675 Batch : D : 10/03/93 T : 10/07/93
